flawed_nl_solution:
He planned on 2 sodas per guest and invited 15 guests so 2*15 =<<2*15=30>>30 cans of soda
Each pack of soda had 6 cans. He needed to buy 30 cans of soda for his guest so 30/6 = <<30/6=5>>5 packs of soda
The soda was on sale for $3 per 6 pack and he was buying 5 packs so 3*5 = $<<3*5=51>>51 for soda
#### 51

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15, not 51. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
